title: 1UP USA Redesigned Its Recon Rack to Be 15% Lighter, Wobble-Free, and Rebuildable
content:
1UP USA, makers of all-metal bike racks, just rolled out its all-new Recon Rack ($1,100). These vertical bolt-together bike racks are now 15% lighter, wobble-free, and rebuildable. Let’s check it out…

As highlighted in our Sea Otter Reportage, the all-new Recon underwent a complete redesign:

  • Built to repair, not replace. This new Recon eliminated welds entirely in favor of a fully bolt-together design. This means every part is serviceable, swappable, and repairable.
  • Less weight, all the reliability. Now featuring aluminum baskets, lower wheel cradles, and side plates, the new Recon drops 15% of its weight without compromising durability or performance.
  • No more wobble. The new version introduces a brand-new wedge-style hitch that snugs into the hitch receiver and delivers rock-solid stability.
  • Easier access. The new pivot system is designed for quick, easy access without sacrificing strength.
  • Symmetrical, aluminum baskets. The redesigned baskets are built to handle a wide range of bikes without the need for adapters or extra baskets.

The 15% lighter Recon comes in three configurations—four, five, or six-bike setups. The quick-load design means less fiddling and more riding.

Designed, machined, and tested in the U.S., this rack is all business: aero-grade aluminum, burly cradles to lock in your rig, and a vertical profile that means business without mangling your tailgate or your bike.

Check out the all-new Recon at 1UP USA.
